source_note: State baseline derived from North Carolina DEQ Division of Environmental Assistance and Customer Service (DEACS).

organics.guidance: Yard waste banned from landfills; food waste composting expanding under DEQ programs.
organics.bin: Green/yard waste bin or compost site.
organics.notes: Composting programs available in Raleigh, Charlotte, and Asheville.
provenance: NC DEQ Solid Waste and Organics Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.notes: No waxed or greasy paper products.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1–#7.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: North Carolina does not have a deposit law.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through collection or HHW programs.
household_batteries.bin: Battery drop-off or auto parts store.

e_waste.guidance: Electronics banned from landfills under NC General Statutes §130A-309.10.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Retailers must offer bag collection in coastal counties.

bulky_items.guidance: Schedule pickup or deliver bulky items to landfill or transfer station.
